revised_title: Infra-red Spectroscopic Studies of Polymethylene Halides' Rotational Isomerism
tldr: The authors studied the infra-red spectra of polymethylene halides to analyze their rotational isomerism. They found that the solid-state spectra of these compounds show different configurations, including non-planar arrangements of halogen atoms. By comparing the spectra with related molecules, they assigned configurations to the solid-state and some liquid-state isomers, providing insights into the molecular structures of these compounds.
